And, just like that, President Donald Trump — who has previously indicated he’d cooperate with Russia special counsel Robert Mueller — cast doubt on his participation.

THANKS, OBAMA: Mimicking a favored fundraising tactic of President Barack Obama, President Trump’s reelection campaign is offering a dinner at Mar-a-Lago with the president in exchange for a donation as small as $3 donation.

Elsewhere in President Trump’s orbit:

STILL ON THE DACA-ET: After a court ruling that seemingly allows DACA to go forward, lawmakers were thrown off stride but still seem to agree that urgent action is needed soon.

At his news conference, Trump seemed to hedge on whether the U.S. would rejoin the Paris climate agreement, saying the country could “conceivably go back.”

“As usual, they made a bad deal," Trump said.
Trump’s waffling on Mueller was one of a number of headlines to emerge from a typically news jammed day which included, a joint appearance with Norway’s visiting Prime Minister, Erna Solberg.
Earlier, Trump complained about an out-of-control judiciary via Twitter, after a judge overruled his executive order on the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program known as DACA.
WHOA, CANADA: Our neighbors to the north believe that the U.S. intends to pull out of NAFTA and are bracing for it when the U.S., Mexico and Canada meet in Montreal later this month.
PUTIN THE DRAWER: The Daily Beast reports a Trump national security official floated removing U.S. troops from eastern Europe as a way of appeasing Russian President Vladimir Putin.
NO SERVICE: The White House is banning the use of personal phones in the West Wing as of Jan. 16, with violators of the policy subject to internal discipline, per a memo.

(Reuters)

ISSA ENOUGH: California GOP Rep. Darrell Issa won’t seek reelection — another sign that a potential Democratic wave is building ahead of midterm elections.
